data.title: summer retreat in the mountains
data.text:
The Lodge is just a short walk to the Snowbird Center. The concrete and wood paneling were intriguing inside and out. It's not the most modern hotel, but it's cute and has a distinct vibe. There are complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the lobby. 

We had regular bedroom accommodations. Though there's no a/c, the temperature when we were there in August actually wasn't too bad. We kept the screen door open when we were in the room, but there are several fans available if you need them. 

It was surprisingly spacious with two sinks, one inside the bathroom and one just outside the bathroom. We had a shared balcony and the most gorgeous view of the mountains. The minifridge allowed us to keep our own food, and there was a microwave available on request. There is cable tv in addition to the dvd player. The wifi worked great. The gym was small but had a range of aerobic equipment and weight machines. We enjoyed the experience.

data.title: Too Hot in the Summer. Time for a Refurb.
data.text:
Snowbird is in a beautiful location, and while their activity and cleaning staff are wonderful, this lodge, and their other staff need work.  

First, this lodge has NO air conditioning.  You have to sleep with the windows open and loud fans on.  It feels more like glamping.  The old oak cabinets need replacing or refinishing.  The room was clean, and their cleaning staff was excellent.  The rest of the staff was not great. The check in people were less than helpful.  For the price you pay, and the level of service that is expected, I would rather go to Park City.  This is a one night stay place in the summer, maybe more in the winter.

data.title: Dr. Ron
data.text: High in the mountains overlooking the Canyon & Salt Lake, this ski lodge resort is spectacular! Very popular with all ages. There are six restaurants on property from high end to snack bars. Views from the lift are awesome. Bring your camera. Try the steak house - superb. Winter or summer, it is excellent.

data.title: Die hard skiers will choose this
data.text:
Snowbird is by far one of the best ski resorts that I've ever skiied. We had 5 days of skiing fun with my colleagues and we chose Lodge At Snowbird to be as our accommodation. 
The Logde is built on 70's and the overall appearance gives reflects from that decade but that's fine since all amenities are matched together. 
Rooms are spacious and bed's are perfect to get good night sleep after a skiing day. Location of the Lodge is superb  while it nests just opposite Snowbird center and gives easy access to Aerial Tram and all facilities that are needed to start good skiing day straight after you have picked up your gear from Ski Locker Room. The pool and sauna gives nice way to relax after getting skiing day done.
Most helpful staff (bell boys are super nice) and especially Hotel manager are so delightfully charming that I couldn't ask for more.
Only downside is that hotel doesn't offer breakfast so it has to be prepared by your self and all the rooms doesn't have kitchenette or similar. Otherwise I can give a strong recommodation for the Lodge when choosing qualitity ski resort accommodation for your vacation. By the way: Wifi is free and works well.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text:
I came there for a week with my school to review for a French exam and it was quite great there.
The employees were helpful and really smiley. Furthermore, they were a lot helpful for example to help us carry at the end our luggages down the stairs.
I loved my stay there.

data.title: Third time here
data.text: This year we took the family and had adjoining rooms, which was able to sleep 5 very comfortably. This is our 3rd time at the lodge. The staff is as helpful and courteous as can be. Ally was outstanding customer service along with Jim being ever so helpful. The convenience of the slopes so close, is number 1, but also dropping your skiis by the tram, the complimentary coffee, tea, etc, the cocktail hour.  Well, I feel everything is wonderful at the Lodge and we will plan another trip there next year.

data.title: Great location and service!
data.text: This ski lodge is smaller than the Cliff Lodge (a plus), with a great staff.  There is free daily newspaper, coffee, tea, hot chocolate in the lobby.  Nice fireplace in the lobby.  Room had lots of space and storeage for our ski stuff.  Plus they left us chocolates and cookies every day for our apres ski.  Beautiful view of the mountain with large balcony. Loved the valet service which we utilized for rides up to Alta, and to restaurants.  The restaurant at the Lodge does not serve breakfast, but dinner service was great.  The Lodge is only about 60 yards from the Snowbird Center.  Would definitely stay there again.  Went with our ski club...so don't know the prices.

data.title: Great for Spring Break Ski Trip
data.text:
My teenage son and I just spent a few days at the Lodge at Snowbird for some spring break skiing, and were very happy with our stay. First of all, it was super convenient to the main tram and lifts, so there was no problem walking over even in ski boots. We took advantage of an early week "ski and stay" package, which made the lodge quite competitive with staying at one of the chain hotels down in the valley. The staff were also very friendly and accommodating. They were able to give us a room on the top floor with a great view, and do both an early check in, as well as a late check out. As a result, our all-too-brief stay felt much longer than it actually was. We were able to get in great skiing (including a powder day!) but have the room available to us each day for lunch.  I was skeptical about having only a sofa bed (due to past experience) but the sofa beds here were quite comfortable and have a very supportive base for the mattress. The staff even cleared snow off and around our car after it snowed! 

Snowbird is a great mountain for skiing and snowboarding, and if/when we go back we would definitely stay here again.

data.title: All around great
data.text:
Solid accommodations with helpful staff and terrific location across from tram and Snowbird center. Units are well equipped, have plenty of space and nice views of mountain. Booked for guys trip.
Not a lot of infrastructure in Snowbird but you can buy basic groceries and beer/wine at general store near Lodge.

data.title: A Great Place to Stay in Snowbird
data.text:
Reservations:  found a special offer online for Snowbird through AMEX that included the room and two 4 day lift passes.
Check-in/Check-out:  friendly and very fast;  let us into the room early as it was already clean.  Also let us check out at 12 noon so we could ski a few hours on the morning of departure.  Helpful advice and discount coupons for ski rentals.
Room:  Loft condo, with full kitchen, balcony, pull out couch, fireplace, two full baths, two queen beds in the loft.  Spotlessly clean. Recently updated.  Modern appliances.  Comfortable furniture.  Flat screen TVs upstairs and downstairs.  Great toiletries, great towels and linens.  Beds were perfect for sleeping while the pullout was very firm.
Location:  Right across a parking lot from the Gondola, a five minute walk. 
There are not a lot of restaurants around Snowbird except in the hotels, but it is a short drive down the mountain to lots of good food in Sandy Utah.  The food on the mountain for you skiers is high quality and cheap compared to most ski resorts.  Also grocery shopping is limited so buy your food in Sandy and take it with you up the mountain.
Wifi:  free and fast. 
Amenities:  nice heated hot tub and swimming pool, plus a small but nicely outfitted gym.  Ski lockers on the ground floor.  Excellent bellman service.  No extra charge for parking!!!

data.title: Excellent Resort in all Aspects
data.text:
Our stay at Snowbird was part of a 7 week Rocky Mountain ski road trip.  Our ski & stay package was the best value of any of the resorts we visited which included Big Sky MT, Red Mountain BC Canada, Grand Targhee WY, Jackson Hole WY, and Steamboat Springs CO.   We had a spacious studio with a full kitchen, plenty of storage for our ski stuff and nice living area with a gas fireplace and an incredible view of the mountain.  The staff were friendly and attentive and always a pleasure to deal with. There is a 24 hour coffee / hot chocolate bar in the lobby, along with a roaring fire and comfortable seating. Twice a week they have an Apres ski wine and cheese party where you can sample nice wines and meet other guests.  Everyday fresh homemade cookies are brought to your room by housekeeping and the rooms are always immaculately cleaned. 
We loved skiing the mountain and the challenge it offers and enjoyed the opportunity to ski Alta through the connector lifts.  The hot tub and pool were a great way to ease sore muscles after an exhilarating day on the runs. 
I must also mention the convenient free ski valet service at the base, the unbelievable new cafeteria at the top of the tram and the excellent shuttle service provided by the hotel between Alta and Snowbird.  
The Lodge provided a great stay and the resort is among the top of our list of places to return to.

data.title: No frills - but we'd go back
data.text:
Agree that the lodge is not much to look at and is dated.  It definitely has the feeling of a bomb shelter.  Evidently, this is for avalanche safety. However, I'm not sure why they can't at least paint the inside walls. 

I cannot say that the room was acceptably clean. The dishes/cookware/utensils in the kitchen all needed to be cleaned before use. Bathrooms, not so clean either. The beds and sheets were fine.

On the plus side, everybody was super nice and accommodating. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen for our family of four. It was very convenient and spacious. Tons of storage. Ski access was great. Very short walk to Snowbird center. Wine reception was very nice.

All the restaurants that we ate at were very good. The Bistro at the lodge was great. They accommodate both reservations and walk-ins in the outer bar area. Expensive – but that is to be expected at any resort. The waits can be very long, so you need to call and make a reservation as soon as possible - preferably even ahead of your vacation.

The hot tub was very clean but could have been hotter. The pool temp was perfect. At times there were not enough towels available - one time, none. 

We did not utilize the ski lockers as the complementary ski valet at The base of the tram at Snowbird Center was more convenient.

All in all, we would probably stay here again. The skiing at Snowbird is phenomenal and the accessibility from Salt Lake City can't be beat. It's somewhat no-frills, but we had a great family vacation.

data.title: Nice accommodations in Snowbird!
data.text: Very quaint hotel within walking distance of Snowbird Center (where ticket sales, ski rentals, shops, & restaurants are).  All big structures in Snowbird are built to withstand avalanches so outdoor architecture is more functional than aesthetic.  I think this hotel has easier access to the high yield areas than Cliff Lodge (which requires walking across the bunny slope to get to Snowbird Center).  Many of the interior decorations have been updated although the bathrooms could use updating. We had a great view of the mountain.  You have access to ski lockers on the 1st floor of the hotel or (at least at the time of this writing) can store them in Snowbird Center next to the Christy store.  The hotel was very clean and we had a mini fridge in the room with 2 comfy queen-size beds.  Don't be alarmed if you hear explosions early in the morning after a snow day - it's just the Avalanche cannons at work! The outdoor pool and hot tub were nice. Wish there was a drier place to place your clothing and keys outdoors while it's snowing.  The Bistro on the 1st floor has great dinners. The hotel has activities and specials every night as well as a hot drink bar available all day (with coffee and hot cocoa).  Would definitely stay here again!

data.title: Great time
data.text:
I loved this place. The service was amazing. Everyone is so friendly. I want to thank everyone that worked the Bistro, you guys made my trip. Thank you so much. And thank you Monte. You're a life saver. I can't wait to come back! Great skiing, great adventure, and great people. 
Love,
Michelle

data.title: Fiercely over-prized
data.text:
Well, if I had paid a fifth of what I have done, I would acknowledge the charm of the rotting 70ies architecture of the place. It has a nice retro feel to it, and one gets the impression as if one had just stepped into a time machine. The location is undoubtedly very good, and this is what the people running this place cash in.

Having said this, I have not paid a fifth of this. This is why I am not very amused. Besides, when the first payment bounced (for reasons unknown to me), I was not told to fix the problem once I am there: No, the booking was canceled with minutes.  

Recently, I was joking in a review on Tripadvisor that offering no wireless internet access as part of a hotel room is like offering no bed. This was obviously a joke, making the point that I consider this an integral element of any accommodation. This comment is put onto a new level by this room, that actually does not have a bed. All that is offered is a sofa one can sleep on. 

Note that I paid a four digit amount in dollars for three nights. In many places, one can stay for a month for this amount.

data.title: Quiet and Relaxing
data.text: We stayed at the Lodge in a studio suite during Oktoberfest.  While we were a bit apprehensive prior to our arrival due to the idea that the  suite had a pull out bed, upon seeing the spacious studio we ended up being thrilled with the accommodations.  The studio suites includes a full kitchen, good sized living room area with a gas fire place, a spacious bathroom and a large patio with the view of the beautiful mountains.  The pull out bed was even pretty comfortable. We enjoyed all of the Oktoberfest beer, food and activities and had a wonderful weekend away, we would highly recommend the Lodge at Snowbird.

data.title: Great stay in Snowbird Utah
data.text: Wonderful accommodations in our two bedroom two bath condo. Very spacious, lots of room for our two couples with privacy for both. Spectacular views of the lovely green mountains and plenty to do at the snowbird resort with hiking, biking, tram rides and October Fest!

data.title: Ski in ski out
data.text: Needs a bit of an update but still comply and a true ski in ski out. I love the ski lockers and the people here are very friendly and helpful. The drinks were a bit hard to get but that is a Utah problem not the resort. The pool area was clean and nice after skiing.

data.title: Terrific service, price, and accomodations
data.text: I had a fantastic stay at the lodge with my organization. The rooms are more than comfortable, well-decorated with stunning balcony views, and the staff really took our stay to the next level. All of the facilities are great for summer or winter stays, and the snowbird center is just across a parking lot with everything you could need during the day. I highly recommend this place for any kind of trip or conference, summer or winter.

data.title: Nice Spring stay at Snowbird
data.text:
I recently stayed at the Lodge at Snowbird.  It was a very nice stay.  It was relaxing and clean.  The accommodations were clean and comfortable.  My wife and I really enjoyed the huge window that covered the entire end of the room.  It looked over the ski runs.  Although ski season had just ended, we still enjoyed sitting and watching the clouds come and go.

The pool is currently closed, but it was a short walk to the sister lodge where we enjoyed the warm heated pool and the hot tub.

The exercise room was small, but it had most of the machines that I needed.

I thought that this was a nice hotel with a lot to offer.
